art_direction: A baroque, monochrome oil painting aesthetic captures the grotesque decay of a haunted theater, using cinematic framing to heighten psychological dread.

scenes.title: The Grand Proscenium
scenes.text: I push through the great oak doors. Dust motes dance in a single beam of moonlight. The air is thick, expectant. An absolute, crushing silence fills the grand foyer, a vacuum waiting to be filled. Then, from the distant stage, a sound. A single, high-pitched wail, like tearing silk. It cuts off. Silence returns, heavier. I came for Grandma's locket, left in the prop room decades ago. That is all.
scenes.image_prompt: My first-person perspective standing inside a massive, decaying theater foyer. A grand staircase sweeps upwards on the left wall. Straight ahead in the center, the tall, ornate doors to the main theater are slightly ajar, with only darkness visible beyond. The floor is cracked marble, littered with dust. choices.text: Cross the auditorium, straight for the stage.
Descend into the orchestra pit to bypass the open space.

scenes.title: The Wooden O
scenes.text: I step onto the stage. The boards groan. A single ghost light stands center stage, casting a pale, sickly circle. The great velvet curtain hangs before me, its crimson fabric shifting as if breathing. The set is wrong. A parlor scene, but the mannequins are fused together. Their plastic limbs melt into fleshy lumps, dressed in peeling finery. A voice, smooth and resonant, echoes from the empty director's box. "You're late. The performance is about to begin."
scenes.image_prompt: My view from center stage, looking out at the vast, dark expanse of empty theater seats. A single ghost light on a tall stand is positioned just to my right, illuminating grotesque, fused-together mannequins arranged in a tableau on the left side of the stage. choices.text: "What is my role?" I shout into the darkness.
Ignore the voice. Sprint for the backstage door, stage right.

scenes.title: A Cacophony of Bone
scenes.text: I drop into the orchestra pit. The darkness is soupy. The smell of rosin and rot is overwhelming. Broken instruments lie in heaps. Humanoid figures slump in the dusty chairs, their bodies fashioned from yellowed sheet music and splintered bone. As I creep past, one turns its head. A papier-mâché face with hollow eyes fixes on me. A low, discordant hum starts, vibrating through the floor. The other figures stir.
scenes.image_prompt: My low-angle perspective from inside the orchestra pit, crouched behind a broken grand piano on the left. In front of me, several humanoid figures made of sheet music and bone sit in dusty chairs. One of them, in the center, is turning its blank, hollow-eyed head directly towards me. choices.text: Scramble out of the pit and make for the backstage door.
Hold my breath and stay perfectly still.

scenes.title: The Sole Spectator
scenes.text: The voice chuckles, a sound like dry leaves. "Your role? You misunderstand." Spotlights slam on, blinding me. They aren't aimed at the stage, but at the audience. Every seat is filled. Grotesque parodies of patrons, their faces stitched into rictus grins, their eyes weeping a thick, black ichor. "You are not the performer," the voice booms. "You are the Audience." They begin to applaud. A wet, snapping sound. My hands fly up of their own accord, clapping together in that same sickening rhythm.
scenes.image_prompt: My first-person perspective, blinded by harsh spotlights from the stage rigging above. I can just make out the terrifying audience: rows of monstrous figures in the theater seats, all looking at me. My own hands are visible at the bottom of the frame, blurred in a clapping motion. Hand-painted oil painting, baroque brush texture, classical art style, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, black and white monochrome, grayscale tones, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Fight it. I will not be a part of this.
Give in. The rhythm is... compelling.

scenes.title: The Marionette
scenes.text: I stumble into the wings. It's a forest of ropes, sandbags, and hanging scenery. The air is cold. A figure steps out from behind a painted flat. A woman, or what was one. Her skin is stretched like vellum over a wooden frame, her joints articulated with brass pins. Her mouth is a perfect, silent 'O'. She drifts towards me. In her hand, she holds out a tarnished brass key. A voice, not from her mouth but inside my head, whispers, "The Director requires a new lead. But the prop room... the prop room remembers."
scenes.image_prompt: My view of a cluttered backstage area, filled with hanging ropes and painted stage flats. In the center, a horrific marionette woman stands. Her body is a mix of wood and stretched skin, and she holds a single brass key forward in her hand. Her face is a mask of silent screaming. Hand-painted oil painting, baroque brush texture, classical art style, wide cinematic perspective, movie-like framing, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, black and white monochrome, grayscale tones, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Snatch the key and run for the prop room door.
Refuse. Shove the thing and fight my way past.

scenes.title: A Rending Ovation
scenes.text: I scream, trying to pull my hands apart. The force is immense. I grit my teeth, pulling until I feel skin tear and hear bone grind. The applause from the monstrous audience grows feverish. I give one last, desperate wrench. My hands are free. And gone. Bloody stumps wave before my face, but the clapping doesn't stop. It echoes from my phantom limbs, a permanent, internal applause for a show I can never leave. My mind fractures. The laughter from the director's box joins in.
scenes.image_prompt: My first-person perspective, looking down at my own bloody, severed wrists. The stumps are still moving in a frantic clapping motion. In the background, the out-of-focus grotesque audience is visible in their seats, cheering silently. scenes.title: One of the Chorus
scenes.text: I stop fighting. I let my hands clap. The rhythm takes me. One-two. It is the beat of the theater's great heart. My flesh tingles, then goes numb. I look down; my skin has the texture of worn velvet. My bones feel like brass railings. I look up at the audience and see my own face on every patron. We smile in unison. We applaud in unison. I am the show, the audience, the dust in the light. There is no 'I' anymore.
scenes.image_prompt: A surreal first-person view. My own hands, visible at the bottom of the frame, are morphing into red velvet and brass. The audience of monstrous figures now all have my face, smiling identically back at me from the sea of seats. scenes.title: The New Lead
scenes.text: I lunge, my hand passing through the marionette's chest as if through smoke. She doesn't flinch. The whisper in my head turns into a triumphant shout. "A spirited improvisation! You show promise!" From the flies above, ropes drop like nooses. They are not rope. They are sinew, wet and strong. They hoist me into the air. I feel my bones snap and reset, my limbs elongating. My jaw is wrenched open into a permanent scream. Below, the marionette curtsies. The curtain begins to rise on my premiere.
scenes.image_prompt: My perspective, being lifted high into the air by thick, fleshy ropes that have wrapped around my arms and body. I am looking down at the stage floor, where the wooden marionette figure is performing an elegant curtsy in the center of a single spotlight. My own limbs are being unnaturally stretched out of frame. scenes.title: The Ghost Light
scenes.text: I grab the key and bolt. I find the prop room door, jam the key into the lock. It turns. I throw myself inside, slamming the heavy door. The room is a tomb of forgotten shows. On a dressing table sits a silver locket. My grandmother's. I pick it up. It floods with a pure, white warmth. A terrible shriek comes from beyond the door, a sound of frustrated hunger. The locket glows brighter. The stone wall behind the table cracks, then crumbles, revealing a narrow, earthen tunnel. The air smells of rain and freedom. I don't look back.
scenes.image_prompt: My first-person view. My hand is in the center of the frame, holding a small silver locket that glows with a brilliant white light. The light illuminates a dusty prop room. Directly in front of me, a hole has crumbled open in a stone wall, revealing a dark, earthen tunnel leading to safety.
